snippet: In an interview, Artur Mas indicated that if he could not hold a legal vote on separation from Spain, he would pursue a longer-term strategy for independence.
abstract: Catalan leader Artur Mas says Catalonia remains on track for its scheduled vote on whether to break from Spain, but suggests he would not push the country to a constitutional crisis by holding the vote if it were deemed illegal.
lead_paragraph: In an interview, Artur Mas indicated that if he could not hold a legal vote on separation from Spain, he would pursue a longer-term strategy for independence.

headline.main: Catalonia’s Leader Plays Down Talk of Secession Crisis
headline.print_headline: Catalonia’s Leader Plays Down Talk of Secession Crisis
